loading_modules.name: 10×3 — ~16 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 sets x ~30s each + 75s rest x 9 = ~16 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Do 10 sets of 3 reps at a heavy load. Rest 60–90s or up to 2–3 min depending on goals. Increase weight by 2.5–5 lb if successful.
loading_modules.example_application: Session 1: 10×3 @ 150 lb, Session 2: 10×3 @ 155 lb, etc. Deload 5–10% if failing sets repeatedly.
loading_modules.important_notes: Heavy loads, short sets. Good balance of intensity and total volume.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 10 sets × 3 reps = 30 total reps

loading_modules.name: 1-6 Drop Set — ~15 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 cycles × (1 single + 2–3 min rest + 6 reps + 2–3 min rest) ≈ 15–18 min total.
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 1 rep at 90–92% of 1RM, rest 2–3 min, then 6 reps at 80–85%. Repeat for 3 total cycles. Increase weights by 2.5–5 lb once you can complete all cycles comfortably.
loading_modules.example_application: Bench press: 205 lb × 1 rep, rest 3 min, 185 lb × 6 reps, rest 3 min. Repeat two more times. Add weight if it feels manageable.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on solid technique for the heavy single. Adequate rest between sets is crucial for consistent performance.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 singles + 3 six-rep sets = 6 total working sets.

loading_modules.name: 3×10 — ~5 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~45s each + 90s rest x 2 = ~5 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Do 3 sets of 10 reps. Add 2.5–5 lb each time you can complete all reps. Deload if failing two sessions in a row.
loading_modules.example_application: Session 1: 3×10 @ 80 lb, Session 2: 3×10 @ 85 lb, etc. If stuck, drop ~5–10% and rebuild.
loading_modules.important_notes: Classic bodybuilding approach. Great for general hypertrophy and endurance.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets × 10 reps = 30 total reps

loading_modules.name: 3×12 — ~5 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~45s each + 90s rest x 2 = ~5 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 3 sets of 12. Increase load by 2.5–5 lb after completing 12 reps in each set. Deload 10% if stuck twice.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 3×12 @ 70 lb, Week 2: 3×12 @ 75 lb, etc. Repeat attempts if missed reps.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on muscle endurance and hypertrophy. Keep rest intervals brief.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets × 12 reps = 36 total reps

loading_modules.name: 3×5 — ~8 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~40s each + 3 min rest x 2 = ~8 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 3 sets of 5 reps. Increase the load by 5 lb (or 2.5 lb) each session if successful. Deload after repeated failures.
loading_modules.example_application: Session 1: 3×5 @ 135 lb, Session 2: 3×5 @ 140 lb. If stuck, reduce weight by ~10%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Core linear progression strategy. Maintain proper form and track all reps.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets × 5 reps = 15 total reps

loading_modules.name: 3×8 — ~5 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~40s each + 90s rest x 2 = ~5 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 3 sets of 8 reps at a constant weight. Increase weight by 5 lb if you can complete all sets. Deload ~10% if you fail twice.
loading_modules.example_application: Session 1: 3×8 @ 100 lb, Session 2: 3×8 @ 105 lb, etc. If you fail 8 reps, retry next session or deload.
loading_modules.important_notes: Keep form strict. Use smaller increments when progress slows.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets × 8 reps = 24 total reps

loading_modules.name: 4x6 Cluster w/ Variable Rest (~12 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x ~1 min each + ~2 min rest => ~12 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: At ~75% 1RM, perform 2 reps, rest 10s, 2 reps, rest 20s, 2 reps = 6 total reps per set. Rest 2–3 min, then repeat for 4 sets. Increase load 2.5–5 lbs when you can complete all sets cleanly.
loading_modules.example_application: Barbell Row @ 150 lbs: 2 reps, rest 10s, 2 reps, rest 20s, 2 reps. That’s 1 set of 6. Do 4 sets total. If all 24 reps are strong, bump to 155 lbs next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Short rests within each set help maintain form while keeping intensity moderate.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets x 6 reps => 24 total reps

loading_modules.name: 4×6 — ~9 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x ~40s each + 2 min rest x 3 = ~9 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 4 sets of 6 reps. Add 2.5–5 lb each time you get all reps. Deload 5–10% if you fail twice in a row.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 4×6 @ 150 lb, Week 2: 4×6 @ 155 lb. If missed reps, retry next session or reduce weight.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on proper form and moderate rest (2–3 min). Smaller increments may be required for presses.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets × 6 reps = 24 total reps

loading_modules.name: 4×8 — ~8 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x ~45s each + 90s rest x 3 = ~8 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 4 sets of 8. Increase 2.5–5 lb when you hit 8 reps in all sets. Deload if you fail the same weight twice.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 4×8 @ 100 lb, Week 2: 4×8 @ 105 lb. If you can’t get 8 reps, retry or lower weight.
loading_modules.important_notes: Popular with intermediates seeking a blend of hypertrophy and moderate strength gains.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets × 8 reps = 32 total reps

loading_modules.name: 5-3-2 Cluster Method (~10 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Each 5-3-2 sequence ~1 min + 2 min rest => ~9-10 min total for 3 sets
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: With ~85% 1RM, do 5 reps, rest 20s, 3 reps, rest 20s, then 2 reps. Rest 2–3 min, repeat for 3 total clusters. Increase weight once all reps are comfortably completed.
loading_modules.example_application: Deadlift @ 300 lbs: 5 reps, rest 20s, 3 reps, rest 20s, 2 reps. After 2 min rest, do 2 more sets of this pattern. If you succeed, add 5 lbs next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Short intra-set rests allow high-intensity reps without full fatigue. Good for strength building.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets x (5+3+2) => 30 reps total

loading_modules.name: 5×10 — ~10 min per session
loading_modules.author_source: Wendler’s BBB / German Volume Training Variation
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~45s each + 90s rest x 4 = ~10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 5 sets of 10 reps with a moderate load (50–60% 1RM). Add 5 lb when you complete all sets. Deload if you stall twice.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 5×10 @ 100 lb, Week 2: 5×10 @ 105 lb, etc. If failure occurs, back off 5–10%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on volume for hypertrophy. Often used as a supplementary block to a main strength lift.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets × 10 reps = 50 total reps

loading_modules.name: 5×3 — ~19 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~40s each + 4 min rest x 4 = ~19 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 5 sets of 3 reps at a heavier load. Increase 2.5–5 lb if all sets succeed. Deload ~10% after two fails.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 5×3 @ 185 lb, Week 2: 5×3 @ 190 lb. If stalled, reduce weight and progress again.
loading_modules.important_notes: Allows for heavier weights with lower volume than 5×5, requiring adequate rest.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets × 3 reps = 15 total reps

loading_modules.name: 5x5 Cluster Variation (~13 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~30s work + 15s cluster rests + ~2 min rest/set => ~13 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Select a load you can do for ~6–7 reps. Perform 2 reps, rest 15s, 2 reps, rest 15s, 1 rep to reach 5 reps total. Rest 2–3 min, repeat for 5 total sets. Increase weight 2.5–5 lbs if all sets are done successfully.
loading_modules.example_application: Bench at 185 lbs (can do 7 reps). Do 2 reps, 15s rest, 2 reps, 15s rest, 1 rep = 1 set. Complete 5 sets. If you get all 25 reps, move to 190 lbs next time.
loading_modules.important_notes: Short rests help maintain power across all 5 reps. Keep technique consistent.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets x 5 reps => 25 total reps

loading_modules.name: 5×5 — ~15 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~40s each + 3 min rest x 4 = ~15 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Do 5×5 at a consistent load. Increase 5 lb each session if successful. Deload ~10% after two failed attempts.
loading_modules.example_application: Session 1: 5×5 @ 100 lb, Session 2: 5×5 @ 105 lb, etc. If you fail 5 reps on multiple sets, retry or deload.
loading_modules.important_notes: High emphasis on progressive overload. Good for building foundational strength.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets × 5 reps = 25 total reps

loading_modules.name: 6-1 Wave Loading + Rest-Pause (~15 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Each wave ~6 sets x 15-30s rest => ~4 min + ~2 min rest. 2 waves => ~12-15 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Start at ~80% 1RM for 6 reps, rest ~15s, add weight for 5 reps, rest ~15s, continue down to 1 rep. Optionally do a second wave with slightly heavier loads. Increase weights in small increments (2–3%) each mini-set as reps decrease.
loading_modules.example_application: Wave 1: 6 reps @ 200 lbs, rest 15s, 5 reps @ 205 lbs, rest 15s, 4 reps @ 210 lbs, etc., down to 1 rep ~ 220 lbs. Rest 2 min, repeat a second wave if possible.
loading_modules.important_notes: Stay within safe rep targets. If failing a rep, reduce weight in the next mini-set.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: varies

loading_modules.name: 6x4 Cluster for Power (~12 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6 sets x ~20-30s each + 2 min rest => ~12 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Load ~80% 1RM. Perform 4 explosive reps, rest ~15s if needed to maintain power, then repeat until 6 total sets of 4 are completed. Increase weight 2.5–5 lbs as speed improves.
loading_modules.example_application: Power Clean @ 165 lbs: 4 reps, rest 15s if needed, 4 reps. Repeat until 6 sets total, resting 2 min between. Add weight when bar speed stays high.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on explosiveness and proper form; do not grind reps.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 6 sets x 4 reps => 24 total reps

loading_modules.name: Ashley Jones — Strength Drop Set Style
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Initial 2-3RM set (~30s) + 2-3 mini-sets (15-20s each) + 15s rest intervals ≈ 3 minutes total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Load the bar with your 2–3RM. Perform as many reps as possible, rest 15s, drop the load by 5%, and continue performing reps. Repeat the 15s rest and 5% drop until you have completed a total of six reps in multiple mini-sets.
loading_modules.example_application: If your 2–3RM is 100 kg, do 2 reps, rest 15s, drop to 95 kg, do as many reps, rest 15s, drop to 90 kg, continue until reaching six total reps.
loading_modules.important_notes: Maintain proper form at near-max loads. Only drop weight by around 5% each step. Keep rest intervals to 15s to maintain intensity.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 1 initial set plus 2-3 drop sets to reach 6 total reps

loading_modules.name: Alternating Unilateral Rest-Pause (~8 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Alternate sides to near failure, minimal rest between sides => ~8 min total per exercise
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Choose a unilateral exercise. Perform reps to near-failure on one side, switch to the other, and keep alternating until both sides reach failure. Increase load once you exceed your target rep total (e.g., 20 reps/side).
loading_modules.example_application: Single-Arm Dumbbell Press: Start with 40 lbs for 10 reps each arm. Alternate arms to near-failure. If you can surpass 20 reps total per arm, move to 45 lbs next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Include a deload week if progress stalls; reduce load and rebuild.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: varies

loading_modules.name: Daily Max Training (Bulgarian Adaptation) (~32 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: ~7 sets x ~30s each + 3-5 min rest => ~25-35 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Work up to a ‘daily max’ single at around RPE 9, then do 2–3 backoff sets of 2–3 reps at ~85–90%. If plateauing, reduce frequency or add lighter sessions.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. Bench Press: ramp singles until ~RPE 9 with 275 lb, then 2x2 @ 235–245 lb.
loading_modules.important_notes: Frequent heavy singles require careful fatigue management. Drop to 3–4 sessions a week if recovery suffers.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Varies: ~4–8 total sets of 1–3 reps

loading_modules.name: Cluster Sets @ ~90% 1RM (~12 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 clusters x ~3 min each + ~2 min rest => ~12 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Load ~90% 1RM. Perform 1 rep, rest 20–30s, repeat for up to 5 singles. After 1 cluster, rest 2–3 min. Increase weight 2.5–5 lbs once 5 reps per cluster feel consistent.
loading_modules.example_application: Squat at 315 lbs (90% 1RM): 1 rep, rest 30s, 1 rep... for 5 total singles. If all reps are solid, try 320 lbs next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Maintain perfect form for each single; cluster sets are demanding at high intensities.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: varies

loading_modules.name: EMOM 10 x 2 at ~80% (10 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 sets x ~20s each, remainder of minute as rest, total ~10 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 2 reps at ~80% 1RM on the minute for 10 minutes. Rest the remaining time each minute. Increase by 2.5–5 lb if all sets feel solid.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 10 x 2 at 185 lb. If last sets are strong, next session 190 lb.
loading_modules.important_notes: Keep form consistent. If final sets break down, repeat the weight or reduce it next time.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 10 sets x 2 reps = 20 total reps

loading_modules.name: EMOM 10 x 3 at 70–75% (10 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 sets x ~25s each, remainder of minute as rest, total ~10 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 3 reps at 70–75% 1RM at the top of each minute for 10 minutes. Increase load slightly if you can do all 30 reps with solid form.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 10 x 3 at 150 lb. If all sets are comfortable, move to 155 lb next time.
loading_modules.important_notes: Monitor fatigue in the last few sets. Keep technique consistent throughout all reps.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 10 sets x 3 reps = 30 total reps

loading_modules.name: Ascending-Weight EMOM (1–2 reps, 10 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 sets x ~15-20s each, remainder of minute as rest, total ~10 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 1–2 reps at the start of each minute, beginning around 70% 1RM and increasing the load every 1–2 minutes until ~90%. If you fail a rep, reduce the final jump next time.
loading_modules.example_application: Min 1-2 at 70%, Min 3-4 at 75%, Min 5-6 at 80%, Min 7-8 at 85%, Min 9-10 at 90%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Plan your increments ahead. If top-end feels too heavy, scale back. Keep focus on form as weight increases.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 10 sets x 1–2 reps each = ~10–20 total reps

loading_modules.name: 3×8-to-12 Incremental Progression
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~30-45s + 2 rests x ~90-120s = ~5 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 3 sets of 8 with a weight you can handle for 10–12 reps in good form. If you complete all sets, progress to 3×10 next session, then 3×12. Once you can do 3×12, add 5–10 lbs and return to 3×8. If you fail to hit the reps, use a plateau strategy (retry, add a fourth set, swap exercises, or move to another rep scheme).
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 3×8 with 50 lb DBs. Week 2: 3×10 with 50s. Week 3: 3×12 with 50s. Week 4: Increase to 55 lb DBs and return to 3×8.
loading_modules.important_notes: Start with a weight you can do 10–12 reps with perfect form. If stalled, apply a plateau strategy or switch movements/loading schemes.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3–4 sets of 8–12 reps, typically 24–36 total reps per session per exercise

loading_modules.name: Thomas DeLorme’s APRE 10RM — 4-Set Autoregulated (11 min per session)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Set 1 (~30-45s + 1m rest), Set 2 (~30-45s + 1m rest), Set 3 (~30-45s + 2-3m rest), Set 4 (~30-45s + 3-5m rest) ≈ 11 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform four sets. Sets 1-2 are lighter (50% and 75% of your estimated 10RM). Set 3 is an AMRAP at your 10RM. Based on reps completed in Set 3, adjust the weight for the next session. Set 4 uses the newly adjusted load to finish the session. Rest 1 minute between early sets, then 2-5 minutes before heavier sets.
loading_modules.example_application: If your estimated 10RM for squats is 200 lb, do Set 1: 12 reps at ~100 lb, Set 2: 10 reps at ~150 lb, Set 3: AMRAP at 200 lb. If you get 12 reps, next time add 5-10 lb for the 10RM set. Then Set 4 uses that adjusted weight.
loading_modules.important_notes: Choose an accurate 10RM. Avoid grinding reps; adjust weight up or down based on performance in Set 3. Rest more before heavier sets. This method reduces the need for scheduled deloads.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 working sets total per exercise, typically 10-12 reps on early sets plus an AMRAP and a final heavy set

loading_modules.name: Thomas DeLorme’s APRE 3RM (~11 min per main lift)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Set 1 (~40s) + 1-2min rest, Set 2 (~20s) + 3-4min rest, Set 3 (~30s) + 4-5min rest, Set 4 (~30s) ≈ 11min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 4 sets using a 3RM base. Set 1 at ~50% for 6 reps, Set 2 at ~75% for 3 reps, Set 3 AMRAP at 3RM, Set 4 adjusts weight based on that performance. Next session’s weight also adjusts per the rep count in Set 3.
loading_modules.example_application: If a lifter’s 3RM back squat is 280 lb, do 140 lb x 6 reps, 210 lb x 3 reps, then AMRAP at 280 lb. If 5 reps are achieved, add 5–10 lb next session for the top set.
loading_modules.important_notes: Always use a true 3RM start. Adjust load based on AMRAP performance. Emphasize explosive reps rather than grinding. Designed for advanced lifters focusing on strength.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 total work sets; roughly 6 + 3 + (3–7) + 3 reps each session

loading_modules.name: APRE 6RM — Autoregulatory Strength & Size (10 min per exercise)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets total: ~30-45s each plus 1-5 min rest = ~10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform four sets. Sets 1 and 2 use lighter loads (50% and 75% of 6RM). Set 3 is AMRAP with your 6RM (~85% 1RM). Set 4 uses an adjusted load based on Set 3 performance. Next session’s load is chosen from the adjustment chart. Rest 1–5 minutes depending on set.
loading_modules.example_application: An intermediate lifter with a 200 lb squat 6RM might do: Set 1: 10 reps at 100 lb, rest 1–2 min; Set 2: 6 reps at 150 lb, rest 2–3 min; Set 3: AMRAP at 200 lb, rest 3–5 min; Set 4: adjust weight per the chart; next session add 5–10 lb if 8–12 reps were achieved in Set 3.
loading_modules.important_notes: Accurately identify your true 6RM and track AMRAP performance in Set 3 to guide progressive loading. Emphasize proper form over grinding reps.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 total work sets per exercise: ~10 + 6 + AMRAP + ~6 reps = ~20–30 reps total

loading_modules.name: Double Progression with RPE Caps (~10 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: ~4 sets x 45-60s each + 90-120s rest => ~8-10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick a rep range (e.g., 8–12) and cap each set at RPE 8. Once you can hit the top of the rep range on all sets at ≤RPE 8, increase weight next session.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. 4 sets of 8–12 on bench press. If you do 12 reps each set at RPE 8 or less, add 5 lb next workout.
loading_modules.important_notes: Ensures sufficient volume without overshooting fatigue. Drop the rep range or lighten load to break plateaus.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3-4 sets x 8-12 reps = 24-48 total reps

loading_modules.name: Gironda’s 8×8 — High-Volume (9 min per exercise)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 8 sets x 30-45s + 7 x 30s rest => ~8-9 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 8 sets of 8 reps at 60-70% 1RM, resting 30s or less between sets. Start with a lighter load under your true 8RM. Focus on completing all sets without reaching failure. Gradually reduce rest and then increase load as you adapt.
loading_modules.example_application: For bench press: use 135 lbs (around 60% 1RM) for 8x8 with 30s rest. Once you can complete all sets consistently, add 5-10 lbs next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Avoid failure. Limit the number of heavy compound movements in a single session. Start below your 8RM to maintain quality under short rest intervals.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 8 sets x 8 reps = 64 total reps per exercise

loading_modules.name: GZCLP Tier 1 — Wave Progression (~19 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~30-45s each + 3-5 min rest between sets => ~18-20 min total
loading_modules.spec_movement: squat, bench press, deadlift, overhead press
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Begin with 5×3+ (last set AMRAP), add weight each session until failing base volume (15 total). Then drop to 6×2+, then 10×1+ if needed. After failing 10 singles, test a new 5RM and restart at ~85% of it.
loading_modules.example_application: If starting squat T1 at 185 lb for 5×3+, add 10 lb each time until you miss 15 total reps. Then reduce rep scheme to 6×2+ and continue similarly.
loading_modules.important_notes: Avoid exceeding ~10 reps on AMRAP sets. Keep 1–2 reps in reserve. Once volume goals are missed, move to the next rep wave.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Ranges from 5×3 (15 reps) to 6×2 (12 reps) and 10×1 (10 reps) per session.

loading_modules.name: GZCLP Tier 2 — 3×10→8→6 Progression (~7 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~30-45s each + 2-3 min rest = ~6-8 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Start at 3×10 and add weight each workout until you cannot reach 30 total reps. Then switch to 3×8, then 3×6. After failing at 3×6, reset back to 3×10 at a slightly heavier weight.
loading_modules.example_application: If T2 is bench at 135 lb for 3×10, add 5 lb each session. Once you fail to hit 30 reps total, drop to 3×8 and continue progressing until you fail 24 reps.
loading_modules.important_notes: Maintain moderate rest (2–3 min). Each time you stall, drop the rep scheme and continue linear progression.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Between 18 and 30 total reps (3 sets × 6–10 reps).

loading_modules.name: GZCLP Tier 3 — 3×15 AMRAP Progression (~5 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~45-60s each + 1-1.5 min rest => ~4-6 min total
loading_modules.spec_movement: lat pulldowns, rows, or similar accessories
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 3×15 with the last set as AMRAP. When you reach ~25 reps on the final set, increase the load next session. Keep rest around 1–1.5 min.
loading_modules.example_application: If T3 lat pulldown is 60 lb for 15, 15, and 20 on the last set, work up to ~25 on that last set before adding 5 lb.
loading_modules.important_notes: Use a controlled tempo and focus on form. The AMRAP final set drives progress; add weight once you hit 25 reps.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: At least 45 reps total each session (3×15+).

loading_modules.name: Autoregulatory Progressive Volume (Eric Helms) (~10 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: ~4 sets x 40-60s each + 90-120s rest => ~7-10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Start with ~3 sets at RPE 7. If still at RPE 7 after the third set, add another. Stop when RPE 8 is reached. Increase load when you stay at RPE 7 across all sets.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. Shoulder Press: 3x8 @ RPE 7. If third set is still RPE 7, add a fourth set. If that hits RPE 8, stop.
loading_modules.important_notes: Volume naturally adjusts to daily readiness. Deload by starting fewer sets or lowering RPE.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Varies: from ~3 to 5+ sets at 6–10 reps

loading_modules.name: EMOM 15 x 5 at 50–60% (15 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 15 sets x ~30s each, remainder of minute as rest, total ~15 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 5 reps every minute for 15 minutes at 50–60% 1RM. If 15 minutes is too long, start with 10 and build up. Once 15 sets feel manageable, add weight.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 10 min at 115 lb (5 reps/min). Week 2: 12 min. Week 3: 15 min. Then add 5 lb and repeat.
loading_modules.important_notes: Aim for consistent form across high volume. If you struggle to complete 5 reps near the end, reduce load or sets.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 15 sets x 5 reps = 75 total reps

loading_modules.name: Fatigue-Stop Sets (Juggernaut Method) (~8 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x 45-60s each + 90-120s rest => ~8-10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Do 3–4 sets of a given rep number at ~70%. On the final set, AMRAP until RPE 9. Add weight when you exceed the target reps comfortably. Deload by dropping weight or switching to fewer reps.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. Squat: 3x8 @ 70% 1RM, then final set AMRAP stopping at RPE 9. If you manage 12 reps, add weight next time.
loading_modules.important_notes: Stop before true failure to control fatigue; use the final set as a performance gauge.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets of 8, plus extra on final set => ~32+ reps total

loading_modules.name: Wave EMOM (3/2/1 Triplet, ~9 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 9 sets x ~20-30s each, remainder of minute rest, total ~9 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use triplet waves of 3/2/1 across 9 minutes (3 waves). Each minute do the prescribed reps at progressively heavier loads. Slightly increase weights each wave if form allows.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on technique as weight increases each wave. If a heavier single fails, reduce the top percentages next session.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Total 9 sets. 3 waves of 3/2/1 = 18 reps overall

loading_modules.name: Long EMOM (1–2 reps, 70–80% 1RM, 20 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 20 sets x ~15-20s each, remainder of minute as rest, total ~20 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 1–2 reps at 70–80% 1RM every minute for 20 minutes. If 20 sets is too much, start with 15. Increase weight gradually if it remains easy.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 20 x 1 at 185 lb. If consistent, next time 20 x 2 or add 5 lb.
loading_modules.important_notes: High total sets. Watch form across all sets. Drop to 15 minutes if you can’t sustain quality reps.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 20 sets x 1–2 reps = 20–40 total reps

loading_modules.name: Mechanical Advantage Drop Set — ~10 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 positions x ~20–30s each + minimal transition rest, then 1–2 min rest if repeated. ~10 min for multiple rounds.
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Choose one weight. Perform 6–8 reps in the weakest position, immediately shift to a stronger position and go to failure, then shift again to the strongest position and continue to failure. Increase weight when you can exceed 8 reps in the initial position.
loading_modules.example_application: Biceps curls: Wide-grip for 6 reps, switch to standard for AMRAP, switch to close-grip for AMRAP. Increase load once you can exceed 8 reps wide-grip.
loading_modules.important_notes: Use quick transitions between positions. Each mechanical shift allows you to continue with the same weight beyond the initial failure point.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 segments per sequence (weaker, standard, strongest).

loading_modules.name: Myo-Reps (12–20 rep activation) ~8 min
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 1 activation set (~45s) + several 20s rests + 3-5 rep mini-sets => ~8 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform an activation set of 12–20 reps near failure, rest ~20s, then do mini-sets of 3–5 reps with 20s rest until you can’t reach 3 reps. Increase weight once total volume hits 20–25 reps.
loading_modules.example_application: Leg Press: 200 lbs for 15 reps, rest 20s, do 4 reps, rest 20s, do 3 reps, etc. Stop when you can’t reach 3 reps. Add 5 lbs next time if you easily surpass 20 total reps.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on continuous tension and minimal rest to maximize recruitment.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: varies

loading_modules.name: Poliquin’s 3 Then 1 Eccentric Wave Method (Approx 14 min/session)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6 sets total; each triple ~15s, each eccentric single ~10s, rest 2–3 min between sets, ~14 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 3 waves, each wave consisting of 1 set of 3 reps at near-max load, rest at least 2 min, then 1 eccentric-only rep (8–10s negative) with ~10% more weight. Rest again, then repeat for 3 total waves.
loading_modules.example_application: If your 3RM bench press is 225 lbs, wave 1 might be 3 reps at 225, rest 2 min, 1 eccentric rep at ~245, rest 2 min, then wave 2 increases the triple to 230 and the single to 250, etc.
loading_modules.important_notes: Stop the eccentric single if you cannot maintain an 8–10 second descent. Adjust loads if form or tempo suffers.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 6 total sets per session (3 sets of 3 reps + 3 single-rep sets) = 12 total reps.

loading_modules.name: Charles Poliquin 5-to-8 Method (16 min per session)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~1.5 min each + 4 min rest between sets => ~16 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick your 5RM. Perform 5 reps, rest 15s, then do 1 rep, rest 15s, do 1 rep, rest 15s, do 1 rep (8 total). Do 3 such sets, resting 3–5 min between. If all reps are completed, add weight (~5 lbs) next session. Limit usage to 2–4 weeks.
loading_modules.example_application: An intermediate lifter with a 200 lb bench press 5RM does 5 reps at 200, rests 15s, does 1 rep, rests 15s, does 1 rep, rests 15s, does 1 rep for 8 total. Then rests 3–5 min and repeats for 3 sets.
loading_modules.important_notes: Avoid failure. If you miss reps, try to improve next time. Stop after 2–4 weeks to prevent burnout.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 sets x 8 reps = 24 total reps per session

loading_modules.name: Wave Loading with Autoregulation (Poliquin) (~25 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: ~6 sets x ~30s each + 3-5 min rest => ~20-30 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform waves of 6 reps (RPE 7), 4 reps (RPE 8), 2 reps (RPE 9). Increase weight in the next wave if it feels easier than expected. Reduce intensity or accumulate more volume if plateaued.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. Wave 1: 6x200 lb, 4x215 lb, 2x230 lb. Wave 2: Add 5 lb to each step. Adjust based on how the first wave felt.
loading_modules.important_notes: Wave volume and intensity can vary widely. Stop if you overshoot RPE or technique breaks down.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Two waves: (6+4+2) x 2 = 24 total reps

loading_modules.name: Rest-Pause (3RM Load) ~8 min
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 2-3 clusters x ~2 min each + ~2 min rest => ~8 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use ~3RM load. Perform 3 reps, rest 30s, then do sets of 2 reps until failure, then singles until failure. Increase weight 2.5–5 lbs once you reach ~10 total reps.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g., Bench Press at 225 lbs (3RM): 3 reps, rest 30s, 2 reps, rest 30s, 2 reps, rest 30s, then singles to failure. If you total ~10 reps, move to 230 lbs next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Maintain strict form; heavy rest-pause can tax technique. Reduce load by 10% if you plateau.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: varies

loading_modules.name: Rest-Pause + Drop Sets (~12 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 1 extended drop set ~2 min; for multiple sets + short rests => ~12 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Pick a weight for ~8 reps to failure, rest 15s, drop 10–15%, do max reps, rest 15s, drop another 10–15%, do max reps. Increase starting weight once you exceed 10 reps on first set.
loading_modules.example_application: Dumbbell Shoulder Press: 50 lbs x 8 reps to failure, rest 15s, drop to 40 lbs x AMRAP, rest 15s, drop to 30 lbs x AMRAP. If initial set hits 10 reps, start with 55 lbs next time.
loading_modules.important_notes: Very taxing. Use deload if you can’t progress or feel excessively fatigued.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: varies

loading_modules.name: Reverse Drop Set — ~10 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets (15–20 reps, then 10–12, then 6–8) each ~30–45s + 1–2 min rest intervals ≈ 10 min total.
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Begin with a lighter weight for 15–20 reps, then increase by 10–20% for 10–12 reps, then increase again for 6–8 reps to failure. Once you exceed each rep range easily, bump up the starting load next session.
loading_modules.example_application: Leg extensions: 60 lb × 15 reps, 70 lb × 10 reps, 80 lb × 6 reps (to failure). If you can do 20 reps on the first set, add weight next time.
loading_modules.important_notes: The final set is heaviest and taken to failure. Maintain tight form on all sets.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 total sets: high reps down to low reps.

loading_modules.name: Reps in Reserve (RIR) Progression (~8 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4 sets x 45-60s each + 90-120s rest => ~8-10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use a weight that leaves 2 reps in the tank for each set. Increase the load once you can do all sets at >2 RIR. If plateauing, lower rep count slightly and rebuild volume.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. 4x10 @ 2 RIR on bench press. If by the fourth set you still feel 3+ reps left, add weight next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Accuracy of RIR calls is key. Adjust load based on perceived leftover reps each set.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 4 sets x 10 reps = 40 total reps

loading_modules.name: RPE-Based Top Set with Backoff Sets (~23 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x ~30-45s each + 3-5 min rest => ~18-25 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform one top set at RPE 8 for 5 reps, then 4 backoff sets at ~90% of that weight. Increase load if top-set RPE is ≤7.5; maintain or adjust if higher. Deload by lowering top-set RPE or switching rep ranges.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. Squat: Top set 5 reps @ RPE 8 with 225 lb, then 4x5 @ ~90% (≈ 200 lb).
loading_modules.important_notes: Honest RPE assessment is crucial. If you overshoot, keep the same load until it becomes easier.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets x 5 reps = 25 total reps

loading_modules.name: PT Pyramid — Bodyweight Pyramid (30 min per session)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Ascending pyramid: 10 sets x (varied reps @ 2 sec per rep + 15 sec between exercises) + 60 sec rest at the peak (~17 min). Descending pyramid: 9 sets x (varied reps @ 2 sec per rep + 15 sec between exercises) (~13 min).
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Start at Step 1 and perform 1 pullup, 2 pushups, and 3 situps. Progressively increase the reps as you ascend the pyramid, multiplying the step number by 1 for pullups, 2 for pushups, and 3 for situps until reaching Step 10 (10 pullups, 20 pushups, 30 situps). After a 1-minute rest at the peak, descend the pyramid by reducing the reps in reverse order until you return to Step 1.
loading_modules.example_application: An intermediate trainee completes the full pyramid: 1-10 steps ascending and 9-1 steps descending, totaling 100 pullups, 200 pushups, and 300 situps in the session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Perform no more than twice a week to avoid overtraining. Modify difficulty using TRX for assistance or additional resistance. Ensure minimal rest between exercises to maintain endurance benefits.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Total volume per session: 100 pullups, 200 pushups, 300 situps.

loading_modules.name: Staley's EDT 6RM PR Zone (15-Minute Session)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Alternating sets of up to 3 reps per exercise with minimal rest over 15 minutes.
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Select two antagonistic exercises. Use a 6RM load for each. Set a timer for 15 minutes and alternate between exercises, performing up to 3 reps per set with minimal rest. As fatigue sets in, reduce to 2 or 1 rep per set. Record total reps for each exercise to establish a PR. In subsequent sessions, aim to exceed the previous total reps before increasing weight by 2.5-5%.
loading_modules.example_application: Example: Shoulder Press (135 lbs) & Lat Pulldown (180 lbs). Perform up to 3 reps per set for each exercise, alternating with minimal rest. Over 15 minutes, accumulate total reps (e.g., 26 shoulder press reps and 30 lat pulldown reps). In future sessions, aim to exceed these totals.
loading_modules.important_notes: Do not exceed 3 reps per set. Maintain proper form throughout. Select exercises that are simple and safe under fatigue. When plateauing, reduce rest periods, modify rep schemes, or slightly adjust exercises.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Typically 24-36 reps per exercise over 15 minutes, depending on fatigue and progression.

loading_modules.name: Standard Drop Set — ~10 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: One sequence: ~1 min lifting (8–10 reps + 2 drop sets) + ~1–2 min rest. Repeated ~3 times ≈ 10 min.
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 8–10 reps near failure, immediately drop the weight by 10–20% and do as many reps as possible, then drop again and repeat. Increase the initial weight when you can exceed 10 reps on the first set.
loading_modules.example_application: Bench press: 185 lb × 8 reps, drop to 165 lb × AMRAP, drop to 145 lb × AMRAP. If you exceed 10 reps on the initial set, add 5 lb next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: Minimize rest between drops; rest 1–2 minutes after the entire drop-set sequence. Maintain good form throughout.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 total sets per drop sequence (1 initial + 2 drops).

loading_modules.name: Static-Dynamic Drop Set — ~10 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: Each sequence: ~15s static hold + dynamic reps to failure + final static hold. 1–2 min rest if repeated. ≈ 10 min total for 2–3 rounds.
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Hold the weight in the hardest position (10–15s), drop 10–20% and do reps to failure, drop another 10–20% and finish with another static hold. Increase hold duration by ~5s weekly or add weight once you adapt.
loading_modules.example_application: Shoulder press: Hold 50 lb dumbbells halfway for 10s, drop to 40 lb for reps to failure, drop to 30 lb and hold halfway to exhaustion. Increase weight or hold time as you progress.
loading_modules.important_notes: Prioritize safe positioning during static holds. Keep transitions quick to sustain intensity.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 phases per sequence (static hold, dynamic reps, static hold), repeated 2–3 times.

loading_modules.name: Thibaudeau’s 2-2-1 Wave
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6 sets x ~15-20s each + 5 x 120s rest = ~12 min total for 2 waves
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 2–3 waves of (2 reps, 2 reps, 1 rep), each set heavier than the last. The next wave begins slightly heavier than the previous wave’s second set.
loading_modules.important_notes: Often used by Olympic lifters for a quick neural boost without too much volume. Stop once you can’t add weight or keep form.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each wave has 5 total reps; 2 waves = 10 reps, 3 waves = 15 reps.

loading_modules.name: Thibaudeau’s 3-2-1 Wave
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6-9 sets x ~15s each + 5-8 rests x 120s each = ~12-18 min total (~15 min avg)
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Lower-rep wave loading for near-max strength. Each wave has sets of 3, 2, and 1 reps at increasing loads; start wave 2 heavier than wave 1.
loading_modules.example_application: Wave 1: 3 reps at ~85%, 2 reps at ~87.5%, 1 rep at ~90%. Wave 2: 3 reps at ~87.5%, 2 at ~90%, 1 at ~92.5%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Stop adding waves when you can no longer increase weight or maintain form. It’s best for short, intense strength peaking phases.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each wave is 3+2+1=6 reps; typically 2-3 waves = 12-18 reps total.

loading_modules.name: Thibaudeau’s 5-3-1 Wave
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 2-3 waves x 3 sets each (~20s/set) + 2 min rest = ~12-19 min total, ~15 min average
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 2–3 waves of 5, 3, and 1 reps. Each wave increases the load per set, and the second (or third) wave starts heavier than the previous wave’s same rep slot.
loading_modules.example_application: Wave 1: 5 reps at 85%, 3 reps at 90%, 1 rep at 92.5%. Wave 2: 5 reps at 87.5%, 3 reps at 92.5%, 1 rep at 95%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Effective for building strength with moderate volume. Adjust number of waves based on performance and avoid grinding failures.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each wave is 5+3+1=9 reps; 2-3 waves total 18-27 reps.

loading_modules.name: Thibaudeau’s 6-4-2 Wave
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6 sets x ~30s each + 5 rests x 120s each = ~12 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use two waves per main exercise. Each wave has sets of 6, 4, and 2 reps, increasing the load each set. The second wave starts heavier than the first.
loading_modules.example_application: Wave 1: 6 reps at ~70%, 4 reps at ~80%, 2 reps at ~85%. Wave 2: 6 reps at ~75%, 4 reps at ~85%, 2 reps at ~90%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Focus on building both size and strength. Keep the number of waves to about two due to fatigue.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 2 waves x (6+4+2) = 24 total reps per exercise

loading_modules.name: Thibaudeau’s 7-5-3 Wave
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 6 sets x ~30s each + 5 rests x 120s each = ~13 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform two waves, each with 7 reps, then 5 reps, then 3 reps at increasing weights. The second wave starts slightly heavier than the first.
loading_modules.example_application: Wave 1: 7 reps at ~75%, 5 reps at ~80%, 3 reps at ~85%. Wave 2: 7 reps at ~80%, 5 reps at ~85%, 3 reps at ~90%.
loading_modules.important_notes: Limit to two waves to avoid excessive fatigue. Keep the first wave conservative and add weight in the second.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 2 waves x (7+5+3) = 30 total reps per exercise

loading_modules.name: Thibaudeau’s Wave Loading Block Approach
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: n/a
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use 7-5-3 waves for 3–4 weeks, then 5-3-1 waves for 4 weeks, and finish with 3-2-1 waves for 3 weeks. Increase loads progressively within each block.
loading_modules.example_application: Weeks 1-4: 2 waves of 7-5-3 per main lift. Weeks 5-8: 2-3 waves of 5-3-1. Weeks 9-11: 2-3 waves of 3-2-1.
loading_modules.important_notes: Transitions from higher reps for size to moderate/low reps for strength and a final phase for near-maximal strength.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Varies by block; wave structure changes each phase.

loading_modules.name: Thibaudeau’s Pendulum Wave Approach
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: n/a
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Rotate different wave schemes each week (e.g., 7-5-3, then 5-3-1, then 3-2-1, etc.) to keep variety high and stimulate different strength and hypertrophy adaptations.
loading_modules.important_notes: Frequent variation helps avoid plateaus. Each weekly wave is performed similarly—start conservatively, add weight each set within the wave.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Varies each week according to the chosen wave rep scheme.

loading_modules.name: EMOM 10 x 1 at ~90% (10 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 sets x ~15s each, remainder of minute as rest, total ~10 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 1 heavy rep at the start of each minute for 10 minutes. Rest the remainder of the minute. If you complete all reps cleanly, add weight next session. If you fail, reduce weight 5–10% next time.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 10 singles at ~200 lb. If all successful, use 205 lb next session. Keep small weight jumps.
loading_modules.important_notes: Emphasize good form and bar speed. If form breaks, reduce the load and rebuild.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 10 sets x 1 rep = 10 total reps per session

loading_modules.name: Three Storm Triple Pyramid (Varies)
loading_modules.author_source: Three Storm Fitness (adapted from Stew Smith PT Pyramid)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 10 steps up and down with minimal rest between exercises, ~2 seconds per rep, 15 seconds between exercises, and 1-minute rest at pyramid peak
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: The Three Storm Triple Pyramid is a bodyweight or mixed-modality workout involving three distinct exercises with varied rep multipliers. You start at 1 rep for the first exercise, 2 for the second, and 3 for the third, increasing each step until reaching a peak (ideally step 10), then descend back to 1. Start with a 1-6-1 pyramid structure and progressively work up to 1-10-1.
loading_modules.example_application: An intermediate trainee might select Ring Pullups x1, Ring Dips x2, and Kettlebell Swings x3. On step 1, they perform 1 pullup, 2 dips, and 3 swings. By step 6, they complete 6 pullups, 12 dips, and 18 swings, before reversing back down to step 1.
loading_modules.important_notes: Mix and match exercises based on your goals and fitness level. Ensure the chosen movements have compatible difficulty levels to maintain intensity without overtraining. Avoid combining heavy spine-loaded exercises with core-centric movements to ensure proper bracing.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 1x exercises: 36-100 reps, 2x exercises: 72-200 reps, 3x exercises: 108-300 reps depending on pyramid steps completed.

loading_modules.name: Time-Based Drop Set — ~10 min per session
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: One sequence: 3×30s work intervals with immediate drops. 1–2 min rest after. ~10 min if repeated 2–3 times.
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform as many reps as possible in 30s at a challenging load, drop 10–20% for another 30s, then drop again for a final 30s. Increase weight or time once you can maintain a steady rep count across intervals.
loading_modules.example_application: Leg press: 200 lb × 30s, drop to 180 lb × 30s, drop to 160 lb × 30s. Rest 1–2 min, then repeat if desired.
loading_modules.important_notes: Quickly reduce weight between intervals to maintain the 30s work period. Ideal for machine-based lifts for easy load changes.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 3 timed intervals per sequence, typically repeated for 2–3 total sequences.

loading_modules.name: Velocity-Based Training (Bryan Mann) (~15 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 4-6 sets x ~30s each + 2-3 min rest => ~10-20 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Use a velocity tracker to maintain a target bar speed (e.g., 0.6 m/s). Perform sets of 3–5 reps until speed drops below threshold. If speed stays high, increase load next session.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. Squat at ~70% 1RM, track velocity each rep. Stop if bar speed dips below 0.6 m/s.
loading_modules.important_notes: Requires specialized equipment for velocity measurement. Adjust load or stop sets based on real-time feedback.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Varies (usually 4-6 sets of 3-5 reps)

loading_modules.name: Wendler’s 5/3/1 — 4-Week Progression (~10 min main sets)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets x ~30-45s each + 3-5 min rest = ~10 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Across four weeks: Week 1 (5s), Week 2 (3s), Week 3 (5/3/1), then Week 4 deload. Each main session has three sets based on 90% of your true 1RM. The final set each week is a ‘+ set’—push for as many quality reps as possible. After the deload, increase your training max by 5 lbs for upper-body lifts and 10 lbs for lower-body lifts, then repeat.
loading_modules.example_application: If your squat 1RM is 300 lbs, use 270 as your training max (90%). Week 1: 65% x 5 (175 lbs), 75% x 5 (205 lbs), 85% x 5+ (230 lbs). Week 2: 70% x 3 (190 lbs), 80% x 3 (215 lbs), 90% x 3+ (245 lbs). Week 3: 75% x 5 (205 lbs), 85% x 3 (230 lbs), 95% x 1+ (255 lbs). Week 4 (deload): 40-60% x 5 each set.
loading_modules.important_notes: Use 90% of your 1RM for training max. Always perform the final set for maximum reps without breaking form. After each 4-week cycle, add 5 lbs to upper-body lifts and 10 lbs to squats/deadlifts. Don’t skip the deload for proper recovery.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Typically 3 working sets weekly (5,3,1 rep targets), plus a deload (3 sets of 5). The ‘+’ sets increase total reps depending on performance.

loading_modules.name: Wendler’s 5/3/1 with Joker Sets — 4-Week Option
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 main sets ~14 min + up to 2+ Joker sets with ~4 min rest each = ~20+ min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Run standard 5/3/1. After the AMRAP set, if still feeling strong, add Joker Sets by increasing weight 5–10% each set for the same rep count. Skip Joker Sets if fatigued. Deload on Week 4 as usual, then add 5 lb (upper) or 10 lb (lower) for the next cycle.
loading_modules.example_application: 5s week main: 65%×5, 75%×5, 85%×5+. If performance is good, do Joker Sets: 90%×5, 95%×5, etc. Repeat for 3s and 1s weeks, then deload in Week 4.
loading_modules.important_notes: Perform Joker Sets only on days you feel strong. They do not affect your Training Max increments. Stop as soon as form or speed declines.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Minimum 3 sets for main work, plus 0–3+ Joker Sets at heavier loads, so total sets vary.

loading_modules.name: Boring But Big (BBB) — 5x10 Supplemental Volume (~20 min/session)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 3 sets heavy (1-5 reps) ~30-45s each + ~4 min rest => ~10 min; then 5 sets (10 reps) ~30-45s each + 90-120s rest => ~10 min; total ~20 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform your main lift first (e.g., squat, bench, deadlift) at your chosen rep scheme, then do 5 sets of 10 reps at about 50-60% of your 1RM. Gradually increase weight or add reps over time to progress.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: Bench Press 3x5, then 5x10 at 50% 1RM. Week 2: Add 5% more load for the 5x10 sets or move to 5x12 while keeping 50%. Continue increasing weight or reps in small increments each week.
loading_modules.important_notes: Track recovery carefully. If soreness or fatigue is excessive, reduce intensity or volume. Consistency in hitting the 5x10 sets after the main lift is key to progress.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Typically 3 sets of the main lift (1-5 reps each) plus 5 sets of 10 reps, totaling ~8 sets and ~65+ reps per session.

loading_modules.name: Wendler’s Boring But Big — Ascending (5x10 Progression)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x 30-45s each + 90s-120s rest between = ~22 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: The Boring But Big (BBB) Ascending module consists of 5 sets of 10 reps, progressively increasing weight each set. Recommended percentages are 30%, 40%, 50%, 60%, and 70% of Training Max (TM). Rest between sets is 60–120 seconds. The progression strategy involves increasing the top set weight over cycles. Cycle options include 30-50% in cycle one, 40-60% in cycle two, and 50-70% in cycle three, after which 70% becomes the new baseline. This method builds hypertrophy and work capacity with a controlled progression.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 5x10 @ 30%, 40%, 50%, 60%, 70% TM. Week 2: Increase top set by 5 lbs. Week 3: Progress to next cycle, adjusting weight as needed.
loading_modules.important_notes: Start conservatively to manage fatigue. If 70% TM is too difficult for 10 reps, reduce it slightly. Superset pressing movements with lat work for efficiency. Avoid excessive fatigue in squats and deadlifts; modify if necessary.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets of 10 reps per exercise

loading_modules.name: Wendler’s Boring But Big — Descending (5x10 Progression)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x 30-45s each + 90s-120s rest between = ~22 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: The Boring But Big (BBB) Descending module consists of 5 sets of 10 reps, progressively decreasing weight each set. Recommended percentages are 70%, 60%, 50%, 40%, and 30% of Training Max (TM). Rest between sets is 60–120 seconds. The progression strategy involves increasing the top set weight over cycles. Cycle options include 50-30% in cycle one, 60-40% in cycle two, and 70-30% in cycle three, after which 70% becomes the new baseline. This method builds hypertrophy and work capacity with a controlled progression.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 5x10 @ 70%, 60%, 50%, 40%, 30% TM. Week 2: Increase top set by 5 lbs. Week 3: Progress to next cycle, adjusting weight as needed.
loading_modules.important_notes: Start conservatively to manage fatigue. If 70% TM is too difficult for 10 reps, reduce it slightly. Superset pressing movements with lat work for efficiency. Avoid excessive fatigue in squats and deadlifts; modify if necessary.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets of 10 reps per exercise

loading_modules.name: Wendler’s Boring But Big — Up/Down (5x10 Progression)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 5 sets x 30-45s each + 90s-120s rest between = ~22 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: The Boring But Big (BBB) Up/Down module consists of 5 sets of 10 reps with a wave-like intensity pattern. The percentages used are 50%, 60%, 70%, 60%, and 50% of Training Max (TM). This structure allows for a heavier peak set in the middle while maintaining volume and reducing excessive fatigue. Rest between sets is 60–120 seconds. The progression model involves gradually increasing the training max over cycles, allowing the weights to self-regulate.
loading_modules.example_application: Week 1: 5x10 @ 50%, 60%, 70%, 60%, 50% TM. Week 2: Increase top set by 5 lbs. Week 3: Progress to next cycle, adjusting weight as needed.
loading_modules.important_notes: Start conservatively, especially for lower body lifts, as the high rep scheme can be fatiguing. Superset pressing movements with lat work for efficiency. Avoid excessive fatigue, particularly on squats and deadlifts. If needed, modify with lighter assistance movements like good mornings or Romanian deadlifts instead of heavy deadlifts.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 5 sets of 10 reps per exercise

loading_modules.name: Speed EMOM 12 x 2 at 65–70% (12 minutes)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: 12 sets x ~15s each, remainder of minute as rest, total ~12 min
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Perform 2 explosive reps every minute for 12 minutes at 65–70% 1RM. Focus on maximum speed. Small increases if bar speed stays high.
loading_modules.example_application: Session 1: 12 x 2 at 135 lb. If speed is good, move to 140 lb next session.
loading_modules.important_notes: If bar speed slows, reduce weight or sets. Maintain strict form and explosive intent.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: 12 sets x 2 reps = 24 total reps

loading_modules.name: Autoregulatory Cluster Sets (Zatsiorsky) (~15 min)
loading_modules.time_per_session_breakdown: ~2-3 cluster sets x ~1.5-2 min each + ~2 min rest => ~10-15 min total
loading_modules.overview_and_execution: Choose a total rep goal (e.g., 12) at ~85% 1RM. Perform small mini-sets (2–4 reps), rest ~10–15s, and repeat until all reps are done. Increase weight or reduce mini-sets needed to complete the total.
loading_modules.example_application: E.g. Deadlift at 85% 1RM: perform 3 reps, rest 15s, 3 reps, rest 15s, etc., until 12 total.
loading_modules.important_notes: Allows higher-quality reps at a heavier load by including short intra-set breaks. If mini-sets get too easy, add weight.
loading_modules.volume_metrics: Each cluster = 12 reps @ 85%. Possibly multiple clusters, e.g. 24 reps total.
